sub_title: Research Technician | iPSc culturing | Molecular Biology | NeuroD group Human Genetics | Leiden University Medical Center
summary:
Organizational talent, Accurate, Social, Helicopter view, Multipotentialist

Interested in biological and environmental issues and like to work on topics that really make sense to make life a bit better. Very good planning and organizing skills are my main features.

In the lab I like working with different cell culture (including iPS cells), histological, molecular and imaging techniques. Also, the data analysis and planning and organizing is my favourite part. I can work in a group, but also independently.

Besides my job in the LUMC, I have my own website about healthy food, lifestyle and travelling, on which I write blogs and share information about these subjects. The link to the website is: https://www.natuurlijklinda.nl/ I'm open for collaborations in reviewing products/books or writing sponsored blogs. Contact me if you're interested.

courses.name: iPS Cell Training Course: Reprogramming Somatic Cells to iPS Cells

profile_positions.description:
Working in the group of Willeke van Roon-Mom, on induced Pluripotent Stemcells (iPSc) for Huntingtons Disease, Alzheimers Disease, SCA1 and SCA3. 

Responsible for keeping the iPSc lab up and running, doing experiments and analyses with these cells (neuronal differentiation of iPSc, organoids, exon skipping, PCR, western blot, etc) and train and help people that also want to work with iPS cells.

Previously I also worked in this group on exon skipping in cell culture, related to Alzheimers Disease.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Technician Human Genetics

profile_positions.description:
Hopped in as Project Manager at the DCRT, when the old one suddenly left. Dutch Center for RNA Therapeutics, consortium, which treats ultra-rare genetic diseases with ASO, AntiSense Oligonucleotide, treatment.

Collaboration of LUMC, Leiden University Medical Center, Radboud Medical Center in Nijmegen and Erasmus Medical Center in Rotterdam.

My work mainly consists of keeping track on all ongoing things, like making a website, communication plan, keeping overview of mutations to consider. Also doing ASO (antisense oligonucleotide) screenings in patient cells.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager DCRT

profile_positions.description: Working in the group of Louise van der Weerd. AD screening in post mortem human brain material, using MRI and histological techniques. Research on the cause of HCHWA-D using histology and molecular techniques. Supporting PhD students by helping them with practical things. Previously also worked on therapy against Alzheimers Disease using VHH antibodies.
profile_positions.title: Senior Research Technician Radiology

profile_positions.description:
In my free time I want to inspire people with my (Dutch) website to live healthy and to feel good. On my website I write about healthy food, healthy lifestyle like yoga, meditation and sports and about my travels to countries all over the world as well as nature in the Netherlands. Next to that I write reviews about products and books that I use. I'm also certified to advice people that want to eat healthier, just to feel good or for specific issues with their health.

I'm open for reviewing your product or book and write my opinion about it or write sponsored blogs. Have a look at my collaborations page on my website (https://www.natuurlijklinda.nl/over-mij/samenwerking/) or my Facebook page (https://www.facebook.nl/natuurlijklinda) or send me a message via LinkedIn.
profile_positions.title: Web Content Writer and owner

profile_positions.description: On Mountainreporters.com I write (in Dutch) about areas where I did nice hikes or other exciting activities. Clicking on the link underneath you will find the stories I wrote for this website.
profile_positions.title: Travelwriter

profile_positions.description: Monthly on Sunday I write a column on Maassluis.nu about things that have something to do with Maassluis, the city where I live. Read my (Dutch) columns via the link.
profile_positions.title: Columnist

profile_positions.description:
Tumor therapy with radiolabeled peptides with use of SPECT/CT, PET, MRI and in vitro assays.
Screening of human tissues on different receptors.
